dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 4380 RH: To designate the El Paso Community Healing Garden National Memorial, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Escobar introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

Additional sponsors: Mr. Vargas, Mr. Cárdenas, Ms. Garcia of Texas, Mr. Soto, Mr. Castro of Texas, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Green of Texas, Mr. Doggett, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Aguilar, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mrs. Fletcher, Mr. Gomez, Mr. García of Illinois, Mr. Correa, Mr. Sablan, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Gallego, Mr. Espaillat, Mr. Vela, Ms. Dean, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Ms. Sánchez, Mr. Levin of California, Mr. Cohen, Ms. Bonamici, Mrs. Hayes, Mr. Trone, Mr. Rush, Ms. Norton, and Mr. Costa
Reported from the Committee on Natural Resources; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To designate the El Paso Community Healing Garden National Memorial, and for other purposes.

section.header: Designation of El Paso Community Healing Garden National Memorial

subsection.text: The Healing Garden located at 6900 Delta Drive, El Paso, Texas, is designated as the El Paso Community Healing Garden National Memorial.

The national memorial designated by this section is not a unit of the National Park System and the designation of the El Paso Community Healing Garden National Memorial shall not require or authorize Federal funds to be expended for any purpose related to that national memorial.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
